label: ham
subject: [R] Rgobbi and colours question
body: 85. Meanwhile to Croesus himself it happened thus:He had a son, of whom I made mention before, who was of good disposition enough but deprived of speech. Now in his former time of prosperity Croesus had done everything that was possible for him, and besides other things which he devised he had also sent messengers to Delphi to inquire concerning him. And the Pythian prophetess spoke to him thus:
